From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of Anand Narasimhan (anandn)
Sent: Wednesday, May 18, 2005 1:55 PM
	
> How can I test package private classes with JUnit. Our test cases
> are generally in a "unittest" subdirectory of the directory where
> the
> classes being test are.
	
I prefer to set up a test directory with a parallel package
structure, just because of this issue.  It also allows the creation
of package-protected test-helper methods in the production classes.

Another advantage is, a separate test hierarchy makes it easier to
deploy a jar file without the test classes. 
 
- --
Jim McMaster
mailto:jim.mcmaster@...
